description: Back-formation from ambivalence, from German Ambivalenz, from Latin ambi- (“in two ways”) + valeō (“be strong”); equivalent to ambi- +‎ -valent.

adjectives.description: ambivalent (comparative more ambivalent, superlative most ambivalent)

entries.meaning: Simultaneously experiencing or expressing opposing or contradictory feelings, beliefs, or motivations.
Alternately having one opinion or feeling, and then the opposite.
examples: His feelings toward his parents are ambivalent.
